hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 30-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 30-day realized volatility below 40% and the 20-day Bollinger Band width contracts to its 30-day low, a breakout above the 20-day upper Bollinger Band on >1.5x average volume will signal a transition to BULL regime with 85% probability over the next 10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility in neutral markets often precede significant directional moves. Bollinger Band compression indicates decreasing volatility and building energy, while a high-volume breakout suggests institutional accumulation and regime change initiation.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Bollinger Band width at 30-day low
BTC price closes > 20-day upper Bollinger Band

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% gain from entry or regime classification changes to BULL (confirmed)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 10 trading days without regime transition confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals fail to produce a sustained BULL regime within 10 days, or result in immediate mean reversion below the breakout level.
